result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan Iverson

defendant.name: Iverson, Alan
defendant.address: 500 N Hill St, La Crescent, MN 55947

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Diversion complied with - Motion and Order to Dismiss signed by J David Rice

10:46 AM  - Def in court w/Atty Joseph G Veenstra.  Gerald R Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 1 -  DC/DA - NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 - dismissed and read in
Don't need a bind over on Ct. 2
Diversion agmt filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs in the last 24 hrs
  Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty but conviction is deferred pursuant to the diversion agmt
The non duty weapon that was in his car was there as he was going to get certified on it the next day so it was there for work. He texted the LCPD Chief to ask if he could talk and he wasn't intercepted but was on his way to tal to the Chief. 
Fox: I wasn't satisfied that he used a firearm during this and if I thought he was I wouldn't be recommending this resolution. I will be making a direction that his personal property be returned. 
Crt: will order a condition of the diversion I want def to undergo a  Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.
DPAH:  5/6/16 @ 1:30 
(there will be an 18 mo internal review at the DA's office in Jackson Cty)

Stip & Order modifying bond:  Stip that 1) Alan Iverson may have contact w/ alleged victim & their children;  2) Alan Iverson may reside in the family home;  3) Consistent w/ victim notification law, DA has spoken w/ alleged victim & atty & victim approves of & requests the modification
Order Modifying Bond conditions signed by Judge J David Rice
Notice Assign of Judge - G Fox - retd not deliv as address, unable to forward.

Def waives the Preliminary Hearing Time Limits
Court accepts waiver.  State will have until Monday for the offer.  Will leave scheduling up to Attorney's.
Mr Veenstra is to notify my assistant by 04-07-14 if you have an agreement or if you are going to have the Preliminary Hearing or waive it.
MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BOND FILED
CRT: Stipulation - You can have contact by telephone, text, email or voice.
Direct contact when exchanging the children.
Contact for any counseling you (Amber) agree to engage in provided you (Amber) approve that contact and counseling in advance by text or email.
Victim (Amber) agrees with conditions.
Court: Other than these provisions there will be No Contact
Parties understand.
New Bond signed by Defendant
Preliminary hearing on March 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

P, in custody, w/Atty Veenstra - complaint filed
Motion for bond reduction/modification 
Ct - $1,000 cash bond reqd - no contact w/Amber I except by emails, supervised visitation w/children to be approved by Amber with Scott Iverson or Susan Flatten, can skype w/children, no firearms, do not take children out of state unless going to Scott Iverson, brother.  Do not discuss matter with children.  Order directing law enforcement. Judge Pasell recuses himself - new judge to be assigned
Prelim Hrg:  3-5-14 @ 2:30 before new judge

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
P, in custody, w/Atty Veenstra - no complaint filed 
Atty filed authorization to appear 
Probable cause stmt filed & signed by Judge Pasell
Initial app:  2-25-14 @ 1:30 (DTP)
$100,000 cash bond reqd - no contact w/Amber I, CI or AI, Probation & Parole or La Crosse County Courthouse unless for court appearances, no weapons & turn over weapons, comply w/Justice Sanctions including GPS
